glosses: a male given name from Proto-Turkic

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish دنك (denk), from Old Anatolian Turkish دك (däŋ), from Proto-Turkic *teŋ (“equal”), ultimately from Middle Chinese 等 (“equal; sort, type, etc.”), or specifically 戥 (“small steelyard for weighing money and similar items”). Cognate with
Old Turkic [script needed] (teŋ, “equal, equivalent, appropriate”),
Kazakh тең (teñ, “equal”),
Uzbek teng (“equal”),
Bashkir тиң (tiñ, “equal”),
Yakut тэҥ (teŋ, “equal”),
Uyghur تەڭ (teng, “equal”).
